Description: Wastewater discharged by a glass manufacturing company in Milford, Mass. into wetlands adjacent to the Charles River will be cleaner as a result of a recent settlement between the manufacturer and the US Environmental Protection Agency. Ardagh Glass Inc. agreed to pay a $103,440 penalty and to fund three environmental projects costing a total of about $121,700 to settle claims it was discharging wastewater in violation of its permits.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epa/newsreleases/settlement-requires-milford-mass-glass-manufacturer-improve-stormwater-treatment.html

Contained in data received from the agency on February 25, 2021 in response to an open records request. Description: Ardagh Glass agreed to pay $3,500,000 civil penalties as part of a consent judgment settling allegations of multiple violations of state Hazardous Waste Control Law at its glass bottle manufacturing facility.
